maml:description.maml:para: Gets the latest Buildkit version number.
Uses GitHub APIs to get the latest BuildKit release version from the moby/buildkit GitHub repository.
This is a string of the latest Buildkit release version.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This returns a string of the latest release version of BuildKit, e.g., v1.2.0.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the latest Containerd version number.
Uses GitHub APIs to get the latest Containerd release version from the containerd/containerd GitHub repository.
This is a string of the latest Containerd release version.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This returns a string of the latest release version of Containerd, e.g., v1.2.0.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the latest Nerdctl version number.
Uses GitHub APIs to get the latest Nerdctl release version from the containerd/nerdctl GitHub repository.
This is a string of the latest Nerdctl release version.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This returns a string of the latest release version of Nerdctl, e.g., v1.2.0.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the latest Windows CNI version number.
Uses GitHub APIs to get the latest Windows CNI plugin release version from the microsoft/windows-container-networking repository.
This is a string of the latest Windows CNI version release version.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This returns a string of the latest release version of Windows CNI, e.g., v1.2.0.

maml:description.maml:para: Registers the Buildkitd service with a prompt to either register with the Containerd CNI config (0-containerd-nat.conf) or not.
Registers the Buildkitd service with a prompt to either register with the Containerd CNI config (0-containerd-nat.conf) or not.

command:parameter.maml:name: BuildKitPath

maml:description.maml:para: Path where Buildkit is installed. If not provided, it defaults to Buildkit path in the environment path variable or `$Env:ProgramFiles\Buildkit`

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Buildkit path in the environment path variable or $Env:ProgramFiles\Buildkit

command:parameter.maml:name: WinCNIPath

maml:description.maml:para: Path where Windows CNI plugin is installed. If not provided, it defaults to Containerd path in the environment path variable or `$Env:ProgramFiles\Containerd`

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Containerd path in the environment path variable or $Env:ProgramFiles\Containerd

maml:description.maml:para: Specify to start Buildkitd service after registration is complete

command:parameter.maml:name: BuildKitPath

maml:description.maml:para: Path where Buildkit is installed. If not provided, it defaults to Buildkit path in the environment path variable or `$Env:ProgramFiles\Buildkit`

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Buildkit path in the environment path variable or $Env:ProgramFiles\Buildkit

command:parameter.maml:name: WinCNIPath

maml:description.maml:para: Path where Windows CNI plugin is installed. If not provided, it defaults to Containerd path in the environment path variable or `$Env:ProgramFiles\Containerd`

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Containerd path in the environment path variable or $Env:ProgramFiles\Containerd

maml:description.maml:para: Specify to start Buildkitd service after registration is complete

maml:alert.maml:para: When the `0-containerd-nat.conf` does not exist, the user is prompted to register buildkitd service with or without this file.
Buildkit conf file not found at ~\cni\conf\0-containerd-nat.conf. Do you want to register buildkit service without containerd cni configuration? [Y] Yes [N] No [?] Help (default is "Y"):
- If a user enters `Y` (default), the user consents to register buildkitd service without the default containerd NAT configuration file.
- If a user enters `N`, buildkitd service is not registered and the user has to register the service themselves.

command:example.maml:title: -- Example 1: Initializes Buildkitd service with the defaults --

dev:remarks.maml:para: Registers buildkitd with the default containerd configurations file `0-containerd-nat.conf` if it is available.

command:example.maml:title: -- Example 2: Initializes Buildkitd service with the defaults --

dev:remarks.maml:para: Registers buildkitd with the default containerd configurations file `0-containerd-nat.conf` found at `$ENV:ProgramFiles\containerd\cni`.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a default containerd configuration file called `config.toml` at the Containerd path and registers the containerd service.
Create a default containerd configuration file called `config.toml` at the Containerd path and registers the containerd service.

command:parameter.maml:name: ContainerdPath

maml:description.maml:para: Path where Containerd is installed.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: The containerd path in the environment path variable or $Env:ProgramFiles\containerd

maml:description.maml:para: Specify to start Containerd service after registration is complete

command:parameter.maml:name: ContainerdPath

maml:description.maml:para: Path where Containerd is installed.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: The containerd path in the environment path variable or $Env:ProgramFiles\containerd

maml:description.maml:para: Specify to start Containerd service after registration is complete
Initializes a NAT network.
Initializes a NAT network.
Name of the new network. Defaults to 'nat'
Gateway IP address. Defaults to default gateway address.
Size of the subnet mask. Defaults to 16
Windows CNI plugin version to use. Defaults to latest version.

command:parameter.maml:name: WinCNIPath

maml:description.maml:para: Absolute path to cni folder.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Path where containerd is installed or $Env:ProgramFiles\Containerd\cni

maml:description.maml:para: Size of the subnet mask. Defaults to 16
Gateway IP address. Defaults to default gateway address.
Name of the new network. Defaults to 'nat'

command:parameter.maml:name: WinCNIPath

maml:description.maml:para: Absolute path to cni folder.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Path where containerd is installed or $Env:ProgramFiles\Containerd\cni

maml:description.maml:para: Windows CNI plugin version to use. Defaults to latest version.

maml:alert.maml:para: The version provided needs to match the installed version. To avoid any issues, it is safer to install the latest version.
If Windowds CNI plugins are not installed at the default or provided path, the user is prompted to install the missing plugins.
Windows CNI plugins have not been installed. Do you want to install the Windows CNI plugins? [Y] Yes [N] No [?] Help (default is "N"):
- If a user enters `Y`, the user to consents to the download and installation of the missing plugins.
- If a user enters `N` (default), execution terminates with an error.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads and installs Buildkit.

Downloads Buildkit files from containerd releases (https://github.com/moby/buildkit/releases)and installs it the provided path. Once installation is complete, the downloaded files are deleted to save on disk space.
Once Buildkit is installed and added to the environment path, we can get the path where it is installed using:

((Get-Command -Name "build*.exe" | Where-Object {$_.Source -like " buildkit*"} | Select-Object -Unique).Source | Split-Path -Parent).TrimEnd("\bin") NOTE: If Buildkit already exists at the specified install path, it will be uninstalled and the specified version will be installed.
Buildkit version to install. Defaults to latest version.
Path to install buildkit. Defaults to `$ENV:ProramFiles\buildkit`
Path to download files. Defaults to user's Downloads folder
Register and start Buildkitd Service once Buildkit installation is done.
Path where Windows CNI plugins are installed. Defaults to $ENV:ProgramFiles\Containerd\cni
Path to download files. Defaults to user's Downloads folder
Path to install buildkit. Defaults to `$ENV:ProramFiles\buildkit`
Buildkit version to install. Defaults to latest version.
Register and start Buildkitd Service once Buildkit installation is done.
Path where Windows CNI plugins are installed. Defaults to $ENV:ProgramFiles\Containerd\cni
Downloads and installs Containerd.

Downloads Containerd files from containerd releases (https://github.com/containerd/containerd/releases)and installs it the provided path. Once installation is complete, the downloaded files are deleted to save on disk space.
Once Containerd is installed and added to the environment path, we can get the path where it is installed using:

((Get-Command -Name containerd.exe).Source | Split-Path -Parent).TrimEnd("\bin")
NOTE: If Containerd already exists at the specified install path, it will be uninstalled and the specified version will be installed.
ContainerD version to install. Defaults to latest version
Path to install containerd. Defaults to `$ENV:ProramFiles\containerd`
Path to download files. Defaults to user's Downloads folder
Register and start Containerd Service once Containerd installation is done
Path to download files. Defaults to user's Downloads folder
Path to install containerd. Defaults to `$ENV:ProramFiles\containerd`
ContainerD version to install. Defaults to latest version
Register and start Containerd Service once Containerd installation is done
Downloads and installs container tool (Containerd, Buildkit, and Nerdctl).
Downloads container tool (Containerd, Buildkit, and Nerdctl) asynchronously and installs them at the specified location.
ContainerD version to install
Buildkit version to install
Nerdctl version to install
Path to Install files. Defaults to Program Files, `$Env:ProgramFiles`
Path to download files. Defaults to user's Downloads folder, `$HOME\Downloads`
Cleanup after installation is done
Buildkit version to install
Cleanup after installation is done
ContainerD version to install
Path to download files. Defaults to user's Downloads folder, `$HOME\Downloads`
Path to Install files. Defaults to Program Files, `$Env:ProgramFiles`
Nerdctl version to install

command:example.maml:title: Example 2: Download Containerd version 1.6.8 and default Nerdctl and Buildkit versions
------ Example 3: Cleanup after installation is complete ------

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads and installs Nerdctl.

Downloads Containerd files from nerdctl releases (https://github.com/containerd/nerdctl/releases)and installs it the provided path. Once installation is complete, the downloaded files are deleted to save on disk space.
Nerdctl version to install. Defaults to latest version.
Path to install Nerdctl. Defaults to `$ENV:ProramFiles\Nerdctl`
Path to download files. Defaults to user's Downloads folder
Path to download files. Defaults to user's Downloads folder
Path to install Nerdctl. Defaults to `$ENV:ProramFiles\Nerdctl`
Nerdctl version to install. Defaults to latest version.
Downloads and installs Windows CNI plugin.
Downloads Windows CNI plugin from windows-container-networking (https://github.com/microsoft/windows-container-networking/releases)and installs it in the specified location.
Windows CNI plugin version to use. Defaults to latest version.

command:parameter.maml:name: WinCNIPath

maml:description.maml:para: Location to install Windows CNI.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Path where containerd is installed or `$Env:ProgramFiles\Containerd`

command:parameter.maml:name: WinCNIPath

maml:description.maml:para: Location to install Windows CNI.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Path where containerd is installed or `$Env:ProgramFiles\Containerd`

maml:description.maml:para: Windows CNI plugin version to use. Defaults to latest version.
List container tools (Containerd, Buildkit, and Nerdctl) install status.
List container tools (Containerd, Buildkit, Nerdctl) and shows if the tool is installed, the installed version and the latest available version.
Show latest release version
Show latest release version
Returns an array of PSCustomObject:

Name Type Description -------- ------- ------- Tool String Name of the container tool. Either Containerd, Buildkit, or Nerdctl. Installed Boolean Specifies whether the tool is installed or not. Version String Installed version. LatestVersion String Latest available version

maml:alert.maml:para: This information may not be accurate if the tools have been installed in a different location and/or the paths have not been added to environment path

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Show-ContainerTools -Latest Tool Installed Version LatestVersion ------ ------ ------ ------ containerd True v1.7.7 v1.7.7 buildkit False - v0.12.2 nerdctl True unknown v1.6.1

maml:description.maml:para: Starts Buildkitd service.
Starts Buildkitd service and waits for 30 seconds for the service to start. If the service does not start within the this time, execution terminates with an error.
Starts Containerd service.
Starts Containerd service and waits for 30 seconds for the service to start. If the service does not start within the this time, execution terminates with an error.
Stops Buildkitd service.
Stops Buildkitd service and waits for 30 seconds for the service to stop. If the service does not stop within the this time, execution terminates with an error.
Stops Containerd service.
Stops Containerd service and waits for 30 seconds for the service to stop. If the service does not stop within the this time, execution terminates with an error.
Uninstalls Buildkit.
To uninstall Buildkit, this command stops buildkitd service and unregisters buildkitd service. The Buildkit directory is then deleted and Buildkit is removed from the environment path.

command:parameter.maml:name: Path

maml:description.maml:para: Buildkit path

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: The Buildkit path in the environment path variable or `$Env:ProgramFiles\Buildkit`

command:parameter.maml:name: Path

maml:description.maml:para: Buildkit path

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: The Buildkit path in the environment path variable or `$Env:ProgramFiles\Buildkit`

maml:description.maml:para: Uninstalls Containerd.
To uninstall Containerd, this function first stops Containerd service and unregisters Containerd service. The Containerd directory is then deleted and Containerd is removed from the environment path.

command:parameter.maml:name: Path

maml:description.maml:para: Containerd path

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: The Containerd path in the environment path variable or `$Env:ProgramFiles\Containerd`

command:parameter.maml:name: Path

maml:description.maml:para: Containerd path

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: The Containerd path in the environment path variable or `$Env:ProgramFiles\Containerd`

maml:description.maml:para: Uninstalls Nerdctl.
To uninstall Nerdctl, the Nerdctl directory is deleted and Nerdctl is removed from the environment path.

command:parameter.maml:name: Path

maml:description.maml:para: Nerdctl path

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: The Nerdctl path in the environment path variable or $Env:ProgramFiles\Nerdctl

command:parameter.maml:name: Path

maml:description.maml:para: Nerdctl path

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: The Nerdctl path in the environment path variable or $Env:ProgramFiles\Nerdctl
